result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ellery H. Ward

records.addlTxt: Review hearing on January 30, 2023 at 09:00 am.
w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
ATTIC:  Domestic Violence VIP Program: Acceptance & Recommendation - DEOJ

Clerk: Amanda. 
Case called at 9:17 am.
State appears by ADA Cody Marschall.  Deft appears, pro se.

Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW.

Court recites collequy with deft re: Waiver of Counsel. 

State moves to: 
Ct.1(Strangulation and Suffocation/Domestic Abuse)>>DRI.
Ct.3(DC/Domestic Abuse)>>DRI.

COURT GRANTS ABOVE.

PLEA to Ct.2(Battery/Domestic Abuse)>>NO CONTEST.

COURT advises defendant of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & questions defendant to understanding; 
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & voluntary made, a factual basis.

A.C.T. makes statement. 

COURT withholds finding and entry of guilt - Court adopts written Deferred Entry of Judgment agreement as signed by all parties and submitted to the Court.
COURT defers matter for a period of 9 months for Defendant to comply with all terms and conditions of written DEOJ agreement.
If defendant is in full compliance with all terms and conditions within that time frame and obtains no new criminal charges, State to DISMISS Ct.2;

DEOJ RH set for 01/30/2023 at 9:00 am.
Bond continues.


Adj: 9:30 am.
Plea hearing on May 2, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Plea hearing set; paper work sent with defendant to bring back at next hearing

Pre-trial conference on April 5, 2022 at 09:20 am.
Preliminary Hearing on April 11, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

No VIOLENT contact with victim(s): A.C.T.   Report to ATTIC Corrections Services (715-848-3202) within one business day of release. Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level (1) supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt:
Clerk: Amanda.
Case called at 2:03 pm.
State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo. Defendant appears from MCJ, and by Attorney Trevor Peterson. 
Date and Time set for IA; VRCW. 

Reading Waived.  Reserve Jurisdiction. 
Court questions deft re: complaint and rights.
Advised Right of Counsel. 

A.C.T. makes statement. 

Prelim Time Limits Waived. 

COURT ORDERS: $1,000 signature bond - CONDITIONS: 
- No VIOLENT contact with victim(s): A.C.T. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.
- Report to ATTIC Corrections Services within one business day of release.Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level 1 supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening. 785-317-5561. 

>>FUTURE DATES: 
Prelim: 4/11 at 2
PTC: 4/5 at 9:20 


Adj: 2:06 pm.
